summary: Judging businesses by their email address or professionals by their attire can be misleading.  Value actions and quality instead
title: Don't Judge a Business by Its Email Address

summary: Time, and indeed, life is what you make of it, as Lou Plummer states in his post today, Time Is What You Make Of It.  And, like Lou, after having to retire early because of a traumatic event in my life, I found myself on the precipice of a dark place.  But even then, faced with a dilemma, I had a choice...

summary:
I read Yordi's thoughtful post, Embracing the Pain, and got the urge for a new July Reply.  Running has never been my thing, but that was not the essence of his post anyway.  What caught my eye were these last lines:

Life seems designed to throw challenges at you, again and again...
title: Re: Embracing the Pain

summary:
Yesterday I was watching a Swedish music documentary.  In one of the scenes, the artist Errol (aka Eddie Meduza) says:

If you think too much, you go crazy.  Take life as it comes...
title: Don't think too much

title: Redshirts on Esquire’s “75 Best Sci-Fi Books of All Time” List
